result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon M. Galloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment and/or education per agent's discretion

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  Random UAs per agent.  No contact w/M.B. or M.T.  
DE has 4 days jail credit if probation revoked.
Defendant may apply for expungment, if law abiding & fine paid in full within 24 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnathon M. Galloway in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton states recs.  State finishes recs.  Atty Lawton states DE waives his right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Lawton acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court reads charges/max penalties to DE.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to 961.41(3g)(am).  Court grants amendment and Atty Lawton pleads NC.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Lawton makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  NC - amended to 961.41(3g)(am) 
Probation for 24 months
Conditions of probation:
AODA/Treatment/Counseling/Evaluations all per agent
Costs/fines/surcharges of $638.00 to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol w/o valid prescription and must notify agent if one is received w/in 2 working days
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business that sells drug paraphernalia
Random urinalysis per agent
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and/or education per agent's discretion
No contact w/M.B. or M.T.
4 days sentence credit only if probation is revoked
If successful on probation after 24 months and all costs paid in full, DE can apply for expungment w/in one year of completion
Return date on September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Johnathon M. Galloway in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton requests more time to get info from/to ADA Newton.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Bond continues.  Time limits continued waived.  Return date scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
